snippet: Community Education Centers, which plays a critical role in New Jersey’s corrections system, has had such financial difficulties that it contemplated filing for bankruptcy in 2010.
abstract: Court documents stemming from a lawsuit filed against Community Education Centers last year by its former chief financial officer David N T Watson show that the company was under threat of bankruptcy in 2010; CEC, which runs halfway houses, has contracts in New Jersey that have paid the company tens of millions of dollars since then, and Gov Chris Christie, who has long championed CEC, is a close friend of CEC senior vice president William J Palatucci; company's troubles have apparently not arisen from its work in New Jersey.
lead_paragraph: Community Education Centers, which plays a critical role in New Jersey’s corrections system, has had such financial difficulties that it contemplated filing for bankruptcy in 2010.

headline.seo: N.J. Halfway-House Operator Plagued by Financial Woes
headline.main: Finances Plague Company Running Halfway Houses
